text: Small bug report: when importing a CSV to HubDB, quoting to escape commas in field values doesn't
can you upload an example csv?
yeah let me just scrub the data out
actually what am I doing, this is going to be public anyway
<@U329914MR|taylorhunt> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/taylorhunt/F3B3NN94Z/distributor-info.csv|distributor-info.csv>

<@U329914MR|taylorhunt> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/taylorhunt/F3BS4N4J1/hubdb-importer-breakage.png|hubdb-importer-breakage> and commented: And this is the breakage in the importer
your screenshot suggests that there isn't a line ending after "Longitude"
when I tried your snippet, it worked correctly for me
<@U22VBL87M|gcornelius> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/gcornelius/F3B3T2ZL1/pasted_image_at_2016_12_07_10_18_am.png|Pasted image at 2016-12-07, 10:18 AM>
how was the csv created?
from JSON with `csvkit`
there's definitely a line ending looking at it in Vim
uploaded via Firefox 52.0a2 on OSX
I deleted and re-added the first line break manually, no change
can confirm it happens with both Add and Replace importing options
<@U22VBL87M|gcornelius> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/gcornelius/F3CE87XBQ/distrib.csv|distrib.csv> and commented: this works for me in both chrome and FF
oh, i can reproduce now after downloading the csv snippet instead of copy and pasting to a new file
bah is this yet another CRLF bug
yeah, the line endings are not all of the same type
I should have known
well, that's an easy enough fix, but I figured y'all might appreciate the bug report
yeah, i filed it as an issue, but i hope you understand that fixing it won't be a to priority. :slightly_smiling_face:
I mean, I won't have problems anymore, but somebody else might
line endings are the gift that keep on giving
thanks for your help
you're welcome. glad we figured it out and have a task to make it a little bit better for future users.
So this Location field type
Is there documentation on querying that into a template?
oh, nevermind, Mapbox doesn't recognize the address anyway
